q1: What is the Flesch Reading Ease score?
a1: The Flesch Reading Ease score rates text on a 0-100 scale. Higher scores indicate easier text. A score of 60-70 is considered standard, easily understood by 13-15 year olds.
q2: What is the Gunning Fog Index?
a2: The Gunning Fog Index estimates the years of education needed to understand a text. A score of 12 means high school level, while a score of 6 means easily readable by most people.
q3: How can I improve my readability score?
a3: Use shorter sentences, simpler words, and avoid jargon. Break long paragraphs into smaller ones. Use active voice instead of passive voice, and aim for one idea per sentence.
q4: What readability score should I target for web content?
a4: For web content targeting a general audience, aim for a Flesch Reading Ease score of 60-70 and a Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of 7-8. This ensures content is accessible to most readers.
